reviewText: My Little Pony - A Very Minty Christmas is a great holiday movie overall.  The songs have that old fashioned holiday spirit charm (with the exception of the fun "Socks" song).  The movie is about one clumsy little pony who breaks the beacon of their Christmas celebration, the "Here Comes Christmas Candy Cane" which guides Santa to Ponyville every year.  With that broken and the threat of no Santa, Minty decides to go to the North Pole herself and make things right again.  The ponies are all well animated, the movie looks great, and the Christmas theme is all Xmas trees, bright lights and the caring goodwill of seasonal cheer.  Nothing religious, but not every movie should be!  So this should be a great movie to show to any varied groups of youngsters since there's no religious bent, no violence or scary moments (other than some wind whipping a hot air balloon around).Those that thought that there needed to be some evildoers in a Christmas movie need to think again... this is a Holiday flick!  Its supposed to be warm, fluffy and filled with good cheer.  It teaches the importance of friendship and being good to one another: two valuable lesson indeed!
summary: A Sweet and Fun Christmas Movie for All Ages
Title: N/A

reviewText: For children of all ages My Little Pony's movie "A Very Minty Christmas" is quite an entertaining movie.  For parents it might be a little too sweet a piece of fluff but that doesn't discount it from being an enjoyable watch.  The voice talents of the ponies are great (especially Minty) and the antics of its title character make it quite entertaining to watch.  This is a surprisingly great film for children!
Title: N/A

reviewText: We purchased this video two years ago as a Christmas present for our four-year-old daughter. It is the story of Christmas time in Pony Land. The story is fun and engaging. I can't even count how many times we've watched this since we purchased it. My daughter still asks to watch it. Even though her fixation with playing with My Lil Pony figures has waned, her love for this video has not.
summary: Great video kids will watch again and again
Title: N/A

reviewText: We just bought this DVD yesterday and we have probably already watched it five times or more.  Our daughter who is two has just in the last couple of months shown preference for certain things and she has chosen My Little Pony, Strawberry Shortcake and the Princesses, typical girly things.  This DVD was a great choice for her because it is sweet, colorful, has a good message of friendship and the songs are great!  Plus she loves horses.  Our first daughter didn't care for girly things, preferring instead to watch Star Wars with her brother.  So, ten years later, we finally have a girly girl to share things like MLP and SS with!  You'll love this DVD and I highly recommend it for your holiday collection, along with Berry Merry Christmas.  Our daughter loves it so much that I am going to purchase the holiday Minty for her that is available.  It plays a song from the movie.  That way, she can watch and cuddle Minty too!  I am with the other reviewer...thank goodness for the prancing ponies!
Title: N/A

reviewText: My Little Pony: A Very Minty Christmas is a cheerful, animated holiday DVD for children featuring the beloved My Little Pony characters. When young Minty accidentally breaks the candy cane beacon meant to show Santa Claus the way to Ponyville, it seems Christmas this year will be bleak - or will it? Minty sets out to save Christmas with her Pony friends, and spread cheer to the despondent. Together they learn that Christmas is about the love of good friends and the power of the heart, with delightful song and dance. Special features include the bonus My Little Pony episode "Dancing in the Clouds" and sing-a-long segments. A wonderfully entertaining and gentle children's story.
summary: A wonderfully entertaining and gentle children's story

reviewText: The movie is actually better written than I expected and both my younger daughters, ages 3 and 6, enjoy watching it and have watched it many times since we received it.  They enjoy it more than the "old" Christmas classics from the 80's that we have on video.  I am interested in getting other My Little Pony videos now.

reviewText: My daughter loves MLP. She has been collecting them for years. She lovesthe new G3ponies (generation 3) but once she discovered the original shows from the1980s, she's not as thrilled with these DVDs as she once was. This DVD and othersfeaturing G3 ponies are so sweet, they're sickly sweet.I am sure a 3 year old would probably prefer this and other G3 pony DVDs but my daughteris 12 and she prefers the original series now. I was shocked when I watched the 1980sshows for the first time. I expected them to be like the "too cute" mega-sugar-coatednew ones, but to my surprise, the old episodes have actual plots and a huge assortmentof non-pony friends, as well as an ongoing assortment of bad guys. They're interesting andmost of them are fairly well written.I really think it depends on the age of the viewer as to which MLP series is more appropriate.I know a lot of people will say I'm wrong for only giving this 3 stars, but I've seen itand that is how my daughter and I feel about this episode. Its very "safe" and very cute,but on the other hand, the original series wasn't as scary as some reviewers have madeit out to be for other DVD reviews.Its not that my daughter hated this episode, but she doesn't watch it over and overlike she does with the first season MLP from the 1980s.Gauge by age.
Title: N/A

reviewText: So this is cute, but the caveat is that it's not the current incarnation of My Little Pony which spawned that brony craze, which gets a lot of bad press, but it comes from the fact that the new cartoons are smart cartoons that are still primarily for kids but have interesting characters and intricate plots (as well as Big Lebowski references)This particular My Little Pony is in the 1980s way where the animation is cruder and the characters are mostly indistinguishable. it's definitely great for kids. If you have kids buy it for them and they will find it sweet. Although I don't really know if they are going to buy the message about socks being an ideal Xmas gift anymore than any of us bought into that when we were kids.But if you like the ponies in their current incarnation for yourself, this will be disappointing.
summary: It's cute but not as cool as the new incarnation.
Title: N/A
